data.title: Amazon, Intel and other tech companies acknowledge rejecting remote work could cost them talent
data.description: Amazon, Pinterest, Intel and PayPal acknowledged they could risk losing tech talent to competitors who offer more appealing job benefits, such as remote work.

data.title: Cutting-edge gallium nitride tech could help EVs charge three times faster
data.description: Navitas Semiconductor, a company that makes tech for super-fast phone chargers with gallium nitride semiconductors, says electric vehicles are its next big bet.

data.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Amazon, Snap, Ford, Clorox and more
data.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

data.title: Suspected Chinese hackers hit News Corp with 'persistent cyberattack' in January
data.description: News Corp suffered a "persistent cyberattack" in January, the company said Friday, and investigators believe Chinese spies may be responsible.

data.title: The Great Reshuffle: Companies are reinventing rules as employees seek remote work, flexible hours and life beyond work
data.description: Four-day workweeks, work-from-anywhere, mental health benefits and bigger raises are just some ways companies are trying to attract and retain talent.

data.title: Volvo and Northvolt to build gigafactory in Sweden with a former Tesla exec in charge
data.description: Volvo Cars plans to become a "fully electric car company" by the year 2030.

data.title: Images emerge of one of the US Navy's newest stealth fighters crashing into the sea
data.description: Images have emerged of a US Navy F-35C stealth fighter crashing into the South China Sea earlier this week.

data.title: BMO downgrades Biogen, asserts company is spending too much on controversial Alzheimer's drug
data.description: Biogen's new Alzheimer's drug aduhelm saw limited pickup in its first few months on the market.
